reviewText:
At last ! An opportunity to see 1920's Rodeo Champion Mabel Strickland actually riding and to marvel at her skill. Nice too to see stuntman Yakima Canutt, a little piece of history. Years ago now, when I was a boy growing up in and just after the second world war my great joy was to go to " Saturday morning flicks ". This film is of that ilk. A beginning, a middle, and an end. Good guys, bad guys and a story easy to follow.
O.K. there is obviously not the slickness and special effects of 21st century cinema. Also I have seen better actors .Never mind. For those of us who like to take our pleasure simple this is a great hour, that moves at a good pace, and where, as they should, the good guys win. By the way the youngsters can watch it too.
  YEE HAW !!!
They keep talking about the silk trade from Mexico, but no silk or any kind of material show up in the whole movie?
